question: Two point charges q<sub>A</sub> = 3 μC and q<sub>B</sub> = –3 μC are located 20 cm apart in vacuum. What is the electric field at the midpoint O of the line AB joining the two charges?

A system has two charges q<sub>A</sub> = 2.5 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C and q<sub>B</sub> = –2.5 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C located at points A: (0, 0, –15 cm) and B: (0, 0, +15 cm), respectively. What is the total charge and electric dipole moment of the system?
options: 0 C, 7.5 × 10<sup>-8</sup> C m along negative z-axis
0 C, 7.5 × 10<sup>-8</sup> C m along positive z-axis

question: An electric dipole with dipole moment 4 × 10<sup>-9</sup> C m is aligned at 30° with the direction of a uniform electric field of magnitude 5 × 10<sup>4</sup> N/C. Calculate the magnitude of the torque acting on the dipole.
A polythene piece rubbed with wool is found to have a negative charge of 3.2 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C. Estimate the number of electrons transferred.

Two insulated charged copper spheres A and B have their centers separated by a distance of 50 cm. The charge on each is 6.5 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C. What is the mutual force of repulsion? (1/4πε₀ = 9 × 10<sup>9</sup> N m² C<sup>-2</sup>)
What is the force between two small charged spheres having charges of 2 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C and 3 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C placed 30 cm apart in air?
The electrostatic force on a small sphere of charge 0.4 μC due to another small sphere of charge –0.8 μC in air is 0.2 N. What is the distance between the two spheres?
A point charge of 2.0 μC is at the centre of a cubic Gaussian surface 9.0 cm on edge. What is the net electric flux through the surface?

A point charge causes an electric flux of –1.0 × 10<sup>3</sup> N m² C<sup>-1</sup> to pass through a spherical Gaussian surface of 10.0 cm radius centered on the charge. What is the value of the point charge?

A conducting sphere of radius 10 cm has an unknown charge. If the electric field 20 cm from the center of the sphere is 1.5 × 10<sup>3</sup> N/C and points radially inward, what is the net charge on the sphere?

Two large, thin metal plates are parallel and close to each other. On their inner faces, the plates have surface charge densities of opposite signs and of magnitude 17.0 × 10<sup>-22</sup> C/m². What is the electric field intensity E: (a) in the outer region of the first plate?
An infinite line charge produces a field of 9 × 10<sup>4</sup> N/C at a distance of 2 cm. Calculate the linear charge density.
A spherical conductor of radius 12 cm has a charge of 1.6 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C distributed uniformly on its surface. What is the electric field (a) inside the sphere?
A spherical conductor of radius 12 cm has a charge of 1.6 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C distributed uniformly on its surface. What is the electric field (b) just outside the sphere?
A spherical conductor of radius 12 cm has a charge of 1.6 × 10<sup>-7</sup> C distributed uniformly on its surface. What is the electric field (c) at a point 18 cm from the center of the sphere?
A uniformly charged conducting sphere of 2.4 m diameter has a surface charge density of 80.0 μC/m². What is the total charge on the sphere?
Two point charges 5 μC and -2 μC are placed at points (5 cm, 0, 0) and (23 cm, 0, 0) respectively. What will be the field at (10 cm, 0, 0)?

A particle of mass 5 × 10<sup>-6</sup> g is kept over a large horizontal sheet of charge of density 4.0 × 10<sup>-6</sup> C/m². What charge should be given to this particle so that if released, it does not fall down? (g = 10 m/s²)

An electric dipole of length 2 cm is placed with its axis making an angle of 60° to a uniform electric field of 10<sup>5</sup> N/C. If it experiences a torque of 8√3 N m, what is the magnitude of its dipole moment?

A hollow cylindrical box of length 1 m and area of cross-section 25 cm² is placed in a three-dimensional coordinate system. If the electric field is given by E = 50x î N/C, what is the net flux through the cylinder?
A charge Q μC is placed at the centre of a cube. The flux through one of its faces is:
A point charge +10 μC is a distance 5 cm directly above the centre of a square of side 10 cm. What is the magnitude of the flux through the square?
A point charge of 2.0 μC is kept at the centre of a cubical box of side 9 cm. What is the net flux through the box?
A uniformly charged straight wire of length 4 m has a linear charge density of 3 × 10<sup>-6</sup> C/m. What is the electric field at a point 3 m from the midpoint of the wire?
A hollow charged conductor has a tiny hole cut into its surface. The electric field in the hole is:
options: Depends on the location of the hole

question: A dipole of dipole moment p is placed in a uniform electric field E. The work done in rotating the dipole from a position of alignment with the field to a position where it makes an angle of 180° with the field is:
The force between two point charges placed in a medium of dielectric constant K is F. If the medium is replaced by another with dielectric constant 2K, the new force becomes:
A charge Q is divided into two parts q and (Q - q). The maximum Coulomb repulsion between them when separated by a fixed distance occurs when:
A proton and an electron are placed in a uniform electric field. The ratio of the acceleration of the electron to that of the proton is: (m<sub>e</sub> and m<sub>p</sub> are their respective masses)
A Gaussian surface is drawn enclosing an electric dipole. The net electric flux through this surface is:
